newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE white sugar futures steady, close above low.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE white sugar futures steady, close above low.

text.p: White sugar futures steadied in later trading on Tuesday to close just above the day's low after coming under pressure from a weak New York market, traders said.

At the 1830 GMT close, May was down $2.10 at $306.00, just above its intraday low of $305.50. Traders noted interest in the May/August switch, which persistently fluctuated between positive and negative territory.
August was down $1.60 at $305.80. Volume was concentrate on the two front months with May trading 1,076 lots and August 518.
Technical analysts pegged May whites support at just above $303.00 -- an upward trendline dating from last month's trough of $293.50.

European traders said they were still awaiting the results of Iraq's tender to buy 120,000 tonnes of sugar under the U.N. oil-for-food deal but noted that details were likely to be sketchy for some time.
The Paris market followed a similar trading pattern to London and all values lost ground.
May closed down $2.30 at $305.50 and August down $2.00 at $305.30.
